title: Hong Kong Court Dismisses First Legal Challenge To New Security Law
content: A senior Hong Kong judge sided with the government on Friday and dismissed the first legal challenge to the city's newly enacted national security law, which had been brought by a jailed protester.
summary: A senior Hong Kong judge sided with the government on Friday and dismissed the first legal challenge to the city's newly enacted national security law, which had been brought by a jailed protester.

title: UK's Guardian Agrees Sale Of 'The Observer', World's Oldest Sunday Paper
content: The Guardian Media Group announced Friday it had agreed to sell the world's oldest Sunday newspaper, The Observer, to online news company Tortoise Media, brushing aside strikes by staff.
summary: The Guardian Media Group announced Friday it had agreed to sell the world's oldest Sunday newspaper, The Observer, to online news company Tortoise Media, brushing aside strikes by staff.

title: David Sacks, Musk's Friend, Is White House Crypto, AI Czar. What He'll Do

title: Syria Rebel Leader Says Goal Is To "Overthrow" Assad Regime
content: Rebel forces pressing a lightning offensive in Syria aim to overthrow President Bashar al-Assad's rule, their Islamist leader said in an interview published on Friday.

title: Kate Middleton To Reflect On "Difficult Times" At Christmas Service In UK
content: Britain's Catherine, Princess of Wales, on Friday will host a Christmas service at Westminster Abbey that will reflect on "the most difficult times" as she returns to public life after her cancer diagnosis.

title: Amid Middle East Tensions, Iran Launches Heaviest Space Payload Into Orbit
content: Iran successfully launched on Friday its heaviest space payload, which includes a satellite and a space tug, using a domestically developed satellite carrier, official media reported.
summary: Iran successfully launched on Friday its heaviest space payload, which includes a satellite and a space tug, using a domestically developed satellite carrier, official media reported.

title: How A Dior Handbag Caused One Of South Korea's Biggest Political Scandals
content: Amid talks of his impeachment, South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is battling a series of blunders, including the brief but controversial imposition of martial law, to save his political career.

title: Jewish Synagogue Set On Fire By Masked Men In Australia's Melbourne
content: Mask-wearing arsonists set a synagogue ablaze in a pre-dawn attack Friday in the Australian city of Melbourne, police said, sparking widespread condemnation.

title: "You're Welcome", Says Trump After Bitcoin Hits New All-Time High
content: US President-elect Donald Trump on Thursday took credit for bitcoin's historic surge past $100,000, telling his social media followers "you're welcome" after the cryptocurrency jumped more than 50 percent since his election victory.

title: Ex-Chile President Michelle Bachelet Awarded Indira Gandhi Peace Prize 2024

title: Professor Who Fled Gaza Teaches Trapped Students From Canada
content: University professor Ahmed Abu Shaban often gets up at 3:00 am in Toronto to remotely teach his students in Gaza -- motivated by loyalty to his trapped pupils, and a deep sense of guilt.
